item.title: 5 Best Multi-Boss Fights In The Dark Souls Games, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Lud and Zallen: Easy to read moves, not the best but fun and fair fight.
  • Demon in Pain & Demon from Below: Long range, pan camera manually, requires patience.
  • Lothric & Lorian: Lothric revives Lorian, epic melee & ranged combat, top tier fight.

The Dark Souls franchise is well known for its high difficulty level that requires both patience and resilience from players. Over the years, fans have developed a strong love-hate relationship with many bosses from this universe, as most of them are extremely punishing, but also fair.

Unfortunately, the same cannot be said when two or more bosses gang up on players and put them at a significant disadvantage. In such cases, catlike reflexes, sturdy armor, proper Estus Flask management, strong weapons, and swift reaction times are necessary to survive. Here are the best multi-boss fights in the Dark Souls games .

5 Lud And Zallen, The King's Pets (Dark Souls 2)

They Have A Very Simple Moveset, But They're Also Very Aggressive

  • Telegraphed attacks that are easy to read after a while
  • Fun fight that's punishing, yet fair

Compared to other multi-boss fights in the Dark Souls franchise, Lud and Zallen 's is far from being the best. However, the feline creatures do pose a challenge and are fun to fight overall. In fact, it would be safe to say that Lud and Zallen are one of the great elements of Dark Souls 2 , despite the bad reputation that the game has among critics and veteran fans.

They don't have a sophisticated moveset and their attacks are frequently clearly telegraphed, making them easy to dodge once players learn their patterns. Moreover, Zallen doesn't jump into the arena until Lud has lost a considerable amount of Health, making the fight somewhat simpler than others where players must fight two or more enemies with full Health bars simultaneously. All in all, while Lud and Zallen's is not the most fun or challenging multi-boss fight in the series, they are a blast to defeat and are arguably one of the high points of Dark Souls 2.

4 Demon In Pain And Demon From Below (Dark Souls 3)

A Relentless Duo, Lock On Is Not Recommended

  • Both demons have absurdly long range and can hit players from a considerable distance
  • It's recommended to pan the camera manually in this boss fight rather than using the lock-on feature

Once players complete the Dark Souls 3 base game, they might think that they have the necessary tools to take on any other challenge the DLCs might throw at them. However, most are quickly humbled when they enter the Ringed City DLC and get a taste of the merciless attacks of the various enemies in the area, and the deadly power behind them.

After falling from a cliff, players will take a long plunge into a circular arena deep inside the Ringed City's bowels—there, they will find the Demon in Pain , and the Demon from Below . While the Demon in Pain and Demon from Below are not the most difficult bosses in the Ringed City, their attacks are quite challenging to dodge, especially if players are using the lock-on feature. Both demons have absurdly long range and are very aggressive with their attacks, so players will have a very hard time finding good windows of opportunity. Although this multi-boss fight does require a ton of skill, patience will be the most important aspect to surviving this encounter. As long as players don't get greedy, they'll be able to defeat both demons and face off against this fight's final challenge: the Demon Prince .

3 Lothric And Lorian (Dark Souls 3)

The Twin Princes Are An Outstanding Way To Close Dark Souls 3

  • Lothric revives Lorian when players think they've won.
  • Players must take out Lothric, as killing Lorian repeatedly will not end this encounter

Few games have final bosses as worthy of the title as Dark Souls 3 's Lothric and Lorian , the Twin Princes. While players will have already visited Lothric Castle early in the game, they won't be able to gain access to these two bosses until they defeat the Dancer of the Boreal Valley and clear out the rest of the Castle. At first, Lothric and Lorian don't seem to be too much of a threat, as the former sits back and watches while the latter attacks players in an aggressive, yet telegraphed way that can easily be read with enough practice.

The real challenge begins when players finally deplete Lorian's health bar, thinking they finally beat him. Lothric will slowly approach his brother's corpse and reanimate him, climbing on his back for mobility. At that point, players will not only have to deal with Lorian's melee attacks, but also with Lothric's ranged magic spells that can do a lot of damage in the blink of an eye. The epicness of this encounter, along with the combination of melee and ranged attacks make this multi-boss fight one of the best in the series.

Players should take into account that focusing on killing Lorian will never end the boss fight, as Lothric will keep reviving him over and over. Players should either focus on Lothric to melt his Health bar or kill Lorian and attack Lothric aggressively as he heals his brother.

2 Ornstein & Smough (Dark Souls)

The Ultimate Skill Check In The Original Dark Souls

  • Players should disable the lock-on feature to keep an eye on both bosses
  • Killing Ornstein first is easier, but players will lose access to his armor

While the original Dark Souls is full of challenging areas and tough bosses, few are as testing as Ornstein & Smough . This duo can be found in Anor Londo and is, to this day, one of the greatest skill checks in gaming history. Ornstein and Smough are unfortunately not optional, so players must deal with them to progress through the story and eventually complete the game. During this exciting and punishing boss fight, players will have to keep an eye on both enemies, as one false step or distraction can be the end.

In most cases, dealing with one enemy should make the fight easier; however, this is not the case with Ornstein & Smough. In fact, when players defeat one of them, the other will gain an intimidating amount of power and size, raising the stakes considerably. Players who want the easier alternative should kill Ornstein first to face giant Smough. He's still very challenging, but his moveset is much more lenient than that of giant Ornstein.

That said, players should know that they will get the armor of the enemy they faced last, so if they want Ornstein's armor, they'll have to kill Smough first and take on the harder alternative.

1 Sister Friede And Father Ariandel (Dark Souls 3)

A Challenging, Yet Welcome Change Of Pace During A Long Fight

  • Father Ariandel is very large, which gives him a considerable attack range
  • The multi-boss fight culminates with a third phase with an absurdly aggressive version of Sister Friede

Last, but certainly not least, there's Sister Friede and Father Ariandel . Found in the late stages of Dark Souls 3's Ashes of Ariandel DLC, this duo pose a significant challenge. Before facing them, players will have to defeat Sister Friede and deplete her Health bar. Once they do, Father Ariandel will join the fight, using his golden bowl to spew fire and engulf the arena in flames. Dealing with both enemies is challenging, as Father Ariandel is quite large, and Sister Friede is very fast, making for a deadly combination.

Players will have to focus on dodging Father Ariandel's smashing attacks and Friede's ice spells, which can quickly cause Frostbite. One of the elements that make this multi-boss fight great is that it tricks players into thinking they've won after defeating the duo, only to surprise them with a third phase where Blackflame Friede steps in. Blackflame Friede is much more aggressive than she was in her first phase and can one-shot players in the blink of an eye.

item.title: LEGO Horizon Adventures File Size Revealed
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • LEGO Horizon Adventures file size is 5.9 GB on Switch and 30 GB on PC, launching on Nov. 14, 2024.
  • LEGO's collaboration with popular franchises like Horizon shows the extent of its reach.
  • The larger PC file size compared to Switch reflects efforts to fit games onto different platforms.

Sony has unveiled the file size for LEGO Horizon Adventures on Switch and PC, detailing that the game's file size will be 5.9 GB and 30 GB, respectively. Based on the Horizon series developed by Guerrilla Games, LEGO Horizon Adventures will land on PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, and PC on November 14, 2024.

All things considered, the existence of LEGO Horizon Adventures says less about the popularity of the Horizon series than about the inevitability of LEGO collaborating with seemingly every pop culture franchise under the sun. Though LEGO games existed before them, TT Games developing LEGO Star Wars and many future LEGO spin-offs was in many ways the beginning of the modern LEGO game phenomenon. And now LEGO is getting more into video game-based crossovers, ranging from medium-defining brands like Nintendo and Super Mario Bros . to Horizon . LEGO Horizon Adventures also promises to be the first day-one multi-platform launch for the series, with previous games in the series debuting on PlayStation consoles first.

Now Sony, via its PlayStation Publishing arm, has revealed just how big a footprint LEGO Horizon Adventures will make on various platforms. Via the game's Steam store page and Nintendo Switch eShop page, it's been revealed that the game will take up 30 GB on PC and 5.9 GB on the Nintendo Switch.

LEGO Horizon Adventures Switch and PC File Sizes Revealed

LEGO Horizon Adventures Size

  • LEGO Horizon Adventures (Switch) - 5.9 GB
  • LEGO Horizon Adventures (PC via Steam) - 30 GB

Though the file size for LEGO Horizon Adventures is shown on the game's Switch and Steam pages, the figure is absent on Horizon 's "home" platform, the PlayStation 5. This is due to the fact that PSN Store pages don't typically list file sizes. Given the relative similarities between platforms, though, it may be safe to assume that players aiming to put Horizon series heroine Aloy and her friends in their minifig forms on PS5 may need to clear around 30 gigabytes of space as well.

It's notable that the Switch version of LEGO Horizon Adventures is significantly smaller, clocking in at less than a third of the PC file size. Given the relatively underpowered hardware of the Switch compared to the PS5 and even lower-end gaming PCs, the small file size probably reflects the efforts made by developers to squeeze games onto the handheld console. That said, developers Studio Gobo and Guerilla Games seem to have compressed the Switch version particularly well. For comparison with another major LEGO title like LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga , clocks in at about 40 GB on PC, 36 GB on PS5, and 15.8 GB on Switch.

It will be interesting to see how LEGO Horizon Adventures does on Switch. Though Horizon is now a multi-platform franchise thanks to the PlayStation-published versions on PC, Switch-exclusive gamers might have no experience with the series given its lack of presence outside PlayStation platforms. A successful debut, though, could validate the change in Sony attitudes regarding Horizon and other exclusive franchises and games.

item.title: All Shenron, Porunga, and Super Shenron Wishes in Dragon Ball: Sparking! ZERO
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get Dragon Balls in Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero
  • All Dragon Ball Wishes in Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero (Shenron, Porunga, and Super Shenron)

There are three sets of Dragon Balls for players to find in Dragon Ball: Sparking! ZERO , each of which summons a different dragon. Much like in the series itself, Shenron, Porunga, and Super Shenron all have different abilities when it comes to the kind of wishes that they're able to grant, making some Dragon Balls a lot more valuable than others.

Thankfully, there are ways to farm Dragon Balls in Dragon Ball: Sparking! ZERO , allowing players to make as many wishes as they like providing they're willing to put in the hard work. The following guide will explain the best ways to get Dragon Balls in Sparking! ZERO as well as information about all of the different wishes that players can make after doing so.

How to Get Dragon Balls in Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero

There are a few different ways to get Dragon Balls in Sparking! ZERO . The easiest is to purchase the season pass or the Ultimate edition of the game, which will allow players to summon Shenron and Super Shenron respectively. As the first season pass is included with the Ultimate edition, it effectively includes both. Players can also receive two full sets of Super Dragon Balls by completing all of the Episode Battles for Goku and Future Trunks, as well as a set of regular Dragon Balls for completing some of Zen-Oh's Orders and Whis's Wishes .

In terms of repeated usage, players can farm Shenron and Porunga Dragon Balls by completing regular battles . The drop rate is incredibly low, but by choosing a stage with Out-of-Bounds and equipping the Rising Fighting Spirit Ability Item (available in the shop for 150,000 Zeni), players can start each fight by firing off a special and secure a ring-out in a matter of seconds. This is also a great way to improve character proficiency, as players can level up to five Sparking! ZERO fighters up at once. They should expect to get a Dragon Ball once every twenty to thirty fights.

After finding all seven of a single type of Sparking! ZERO Dragon Balls, players can summon a dragon from the Come Forth... menu, which is accessed via the main menu.

All Dragon Ball Wishes in Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero (Shenron, Porunga, and Super Shenron)

As mentioned above, each of the three Dragons has its own unique qualities. Shenron will allow players to skip an Episode Battle, Porunga grants three wishes instead of just one, and Super Shenron allows players to unlock two playable fighters (although both of these can be purchased from the shop once players hit Player Level 20). Most of their other wishes are the same, although the amount of Zeni that players will get from the "I want more Zeni" wish varies from dragon to dragon, with Super Shenron offering the most (1,000,000 Zeni) and Shenron offering the least (300,000 Zeni).

  • I want more Zeni - rewards players with either 300,000 or 1,000,000 Zeni (Shenron, Porunga, Super Shenron)
  • I want you to raise my Player Level - provides players with experience (Shenron, Porunga, Super Shenron)
  • I want more titles - allows players to choose from a few different player card titles (Shenron, Porunga, Super Shenron)
  • I want new outfits - allows players to choose from a few different outfits (Shenron and Super Shenron)
  • I want to complete an Episode Battle - rewards players with a Dragon Orb, which can be used to fully complete an Episode Battle, including its secondary objective (Shenron)
  • I want ability items - allows players to choose from a few different Ability Items (Porunga and Super Shenron)
  • I want more characters - allows players to unlock either Goku Black or Fused Zamasu (Super Shenron)

Players will need to have tried and failed an Episode Battle for the I want to complete an Episode Battle wish to appear. It will show up on the second page, which players can cycle to using the shoulder buttons on their controller. After making the wish and receiving their Dragon Orb, players will be able to use it from the stage select screen and then choose the episode that they want to skip.

item.title: Valorant: 9 Overpowered Abilities
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Viper's Pit offers huge protection by hiding the spike and decaying enemies.
  • Yoru's Dimensional Drift allows sneaky invulnerability to catch enemies off-guard.
  • Reyna's Devour provides self-healing in duels, making her a strong individual character.

Valorant is filled with various agents and abilities which players are constantly trying to keep up with. As Riot Games tries to consistently keep up to date with the latest Meta and find ways to balance it between the agents, some abilities become more overpowered than others.

The constant patches change which Valorant abilities are the best, but consistently there are some abilities between the various agents that allow for huge advantages to players who are able to use them. Some of the usages of certain abilities are situational, but some abilities are always useful to have around.

Updated October 8, 2024 by Chris Harkin: Although Valorant is updated frequently, and various abilities are often nerfed or changed entirely, many of the same abilities manage to stay on top of the power ratings for extended periods. Their usage is key to much of the strategy in Valorant.

Although an individual ability doesn't necessarily make an agent one of the very best in the game, some of these abilities are still game-changers in the right situation. Valorant is a game of strategy and trying to keep it balanced is a non-stop task that requires constant supervision. For this reason, this article will continue to receive updates as the abilities in Valorant continue to change.

1 Viper's Pit (Viper)

An Ultimate Ability That Offers Huge Protection

  • Allows Viper To Hide The Active Spike Within
  • Decays Enemies To Make Them Easy To Pick Off

Viper's ultimate ability creates a huge poisonous cloud that covers a large area. This allows Viper to hide inside and protect the spike if it is active, or a site alternatively. Either way, it completely blocks enemies from the area for as long as Viper stays inside, and decays enemies who step within, making any fight a hefty advantage to Viper.

Because of her abilities, in particular this ultimate, Viper has the title of being the best spike defender in Valorant . Enemies stepping into the Viper's Pit will have reduced visibility and so little health that Viper can shut them down easily. Taking on multiple enemies and clutching looks a lot more possible with the Viper's Pit helping, making it one of the most consistently overpowered ultimate abilities in the game.

2 Dimensional Drift (Yoru)

The Ultimate Tool For Sneaking Around Enemies

  • Allows An Invulnerable State To Escape Situations
  • Other Abilities Still Work While Shifting

Few ultimate abilities can shift a round in the direction of the player like Yoru's Dimensional Drift. This ability allows Yoru to enter an invulnerable, invisible state for enough time to get out of an area or sneak behind some enemies to catch them unawares.

While Yoru is drifting, he can still use other abilities, allowing him to blind enemies for teammates, or to allow himself time to come out of the drift and kill them unawares. This makes for a brutal ultimate ability that can turn a round on its head. Yoru's abilities make him a strong agent already, but this in particular can devastate an entire enemy team if used properly and in conjunction with allies.

3 Devour (Reyna)

A Self-Heal For A Duelist Makes Her Ridiculously Strong

  • Allows Reyna To Absorb The Soul Orb Of A Killed Enemy
  • Temporarily Overcharges Health For Dogfight Advantage

Reyna is considered one of the best individual characters in the game. If a team is working well together, they can bring down even a great Reyna player. But in a situation where both teams are doing their own thing, Reyna is devastating. Devour is one of the best abilities in the game because it allows Reyna to heal herself using the corpse of an enemy.

This capability makes it very difficult to take down Reyna when she goes on a rampage, and especially at lower levels, players will often find a Reyna near the top of the scoreboard as one of the best duelist characters in Valorant for picking up kills near-continuously as the rounds go by. Devour is not Reyna’s only great ability, but it is the one that allows her to trade health in duels and regain that health to be at full strength again for more individual battles.

4 Killjoy (Killjoy)

An Ultimate That Can Completely Ruin An Enemy Team's Round

  • A Device That Paralyzes Any Enemies Within A Large Range
  • Can Stop Enemies Getting Near An Activated Spike

Killjoy’s ultimate ability, named after her, has been steadily becoming stronger and a more vitally game-changing ability over recent patches. Since Chamber was brutally nerfed by Riot Games, Killjoy is the best Sentinel in the game and her ultimate ability is a major part of what makes her great.

The ultimate deploys an attack with a wide range which contains and totally paralyzes enemy players caught inside of it. This can be used while the spike is planted to chase off all opposition, and almost no enemy utility can destroy it before the lockdown is complete anymore.

5 Trip Wire (Cypher)

The Best Way To Watch A Team's Back Without Wasting Agents

  • Can Interrupt Enemies Trying To Sneak Behind A Team
  • Alerts The Player And Prepares Them For Danger

Cypher has always been a great character to have on a Valorant team, primarily because of the frustration involved in trying to sneak up behind him. Cypher’s trip wire is a valuable piece of utility that stops enemies from getting near him often.

While this is valuable in itself, the trip wire can also be used to block enemies in a rush to enter a site that Cypher is holding. Adding this to his camera and other utility makes Cypher a deadly opponent to try and get the drop on for any player or character.

6 Updraft (Jett)

Allows Players To Reach All Sorts Of Positions

  • Allows Jett To Fly Up Into The Air
  • Can Get The Jump On Enemies And Get Into High Locations Quickly

Jett is one of the most continuously beloved agents in Valorant . Meta changes are constantly shifting the landscape of which characters are best in the professional setting, but Jett is almost always one of the top duelists in the game. Currently, it is pretty much undeniable.

With new maps released where she flourishes, and a move set which is always devastating to square off against, Jett is one of the greatest agents in Valorant . Her updraft ability is huge, enabling her to get to locations quickly and easily that are inaccessible to almost every other agent in the game.

7 Wingman (Gekko)

Allows The Spike To Be Planted Remotely

  • Allows Gekko To Plant & Defuse The Spike From Afar
  • Incredible Power That Allows Trickery Against Enemies

Gekko is one of the newest agents in Valorant and while the Meta could change at any time, he is still considered to be hugely overpowered. His Wingman ability is one of the more unique ideas that Riot Games have added to a character’s ability, having several uses but one in particular which can be devastating.

When Gekko has the spike, Wingman can take it and plant it for him, enabling him to continue shooting at enemies in the meantime. It can also defuse the spike similarly for him, which is completely ludicrous and will possibly be nerfed in the future. This ability is great for new players trying to learn how to gain points quickly.

8 Leer (Reyna)

One Of The Most Effective Blinds In The Game

  • Allows Reyna To Throw A Blind Through Walls
  • Can Be Shot, But Forces Enough Of A Distraction To Make A Difference

Reyna once again appears for this move which can devastate players, again used more at lower levels of play than at professional ones. Even so, Leer is a devastating move that is incredibly difficult to deal with. It blinds enemies and can be fired through walls, but can be destroyed by enemies.

The problem is that this weakness is actually another strength. Either enemies stay blind or snap to destroy the leer, which allows Reyna to snap around a corner and hit them while they are distracted. Both ways, Reyna gets the advantage and the win with minimal danger to herself at all times.

9 Sova (Shock Arrow)

Allows Sova To Root Out Enemies Hidden In Corners

  • A Damaging AOE Shot
  • Can Ricochet Multiple Times To Catch Enemies

Sova is another agent who has long been considered one of the best in Valorant . Despite nerfs in the past limiting some of his abilities, Sova has stayed near the top of the game. Part of that reason is the incredible versatility of abilities such as the Shock Arrow.

This damaging AOE shot can be fired from Sova’s bow with the player choosing how many times it will bounce before landing. This is one of the most complicated pieces of equipment to get to grips with in Valorant , but it is worth it as one of the very best there is because of how many places it can hit, eliminating enemies hiding in many difficult-to-reach corners.

item.title: Best JRPGs That Focus On Monster Hunting
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Final Fantasy 12 offers intense monster hunting, tactical combat, and a vast world map for a complete JRPG experience.
  • God Eater 3 stands out with fast-paced Aragami hunting gameplay, customization options, and a robust multiplayer system.
  • SaGa: Scarlet Grace - Ambitions provides non-linear exploration, challenging monsters, and narrative rewards for a compelling monster hunting game.

Games in the JRPG genre are not only fun to play because of their combat, but also because they usually feature great stories with likable characters, offering players a wonderful experience. With complex dialogues, multiple branching storylines, and powerful abilities, there's always something new to discover in this genre, regardless of the focus of the game.

When monster-hunting game mechanics are involved, things are taken a step further, as players can plan different strategies to face vicious creatures and emerge victorious from the adrenaline-rushing battles that will take place upon encountering them. Here are some of the best JRPGs that focus on monster hunting .

5 Final Fantasy 12: The Zodiac Age

Hunting For Marks Is Essential To Rid The World Of Danger

  • Platform(s): Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 2, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, PC
  • Released: October 31, 2006
  • Developer(s): Square Enix
  • Genre(s): JRPG, Adventure game
  • Great variety of Marks to hunt
  • Studying the enemy before attacking is key to planning tactical approaches

While Final Fantasy 12: The Zodiac Age is not an open-world game, players can’t be blamed for thinking that it is due to how extensive and complex this title's map is. Featuring strategic combat and a great system that encourages players to hunt monsters, also referred to as “Marks”, throughout the Kingdom of Ivalice, this game offers tons of fun and a complete, entertaining experience for anyone looking for an adventure.

There is a considerable variety of Marks spread throughout the Kingdom of Ivalice, ranging from common beasts to vicious monsters that will not hesitate to attack players and end their run early. Like in similar games in this genre, players will have to plan out tactical approaches to defeat Marks, ensuring that they've studied every creature carefully in order to maximize their chances of success.

4 God Eater 3

Players Must Hunt Down The Dangerous Aragami In This Fast-Paced Title

  • Great customization options
  • Fast-paced combat that will keep players on their toes

God Eater 3 is arguably one of the best JRPGs of the last decade. With fast-paced action and intense adrenaline-rushing combat, this game focuses heavily on the hunting of creatures known as Aragami. As they explore the world, players will control characters wielding powerful weapons known as God Arcs, which are not only very effective at dealing with Aragami, but also play a key role in the game’s story.

Like other creatures in this genre, the Aragami can range from lesser threats to world-ending beings that will stop at nothing to fulfill their evil purposes. One of the greatest features of this game is character customization, as players can choose from several different character abilities, weapon loadouts, and battle styles. God Eater 3 also features a robust multiplayer system that allows players to cooperate from the very beginning. Overall, this title offers a very complete experience for players who are fans of the Monster Hunter franchise and want a similar, yet very different experience in many areas.

3 Tales of Zestiria

An Open-World Adventure With A Good Deal Of Hunting

  • Hellions are created from the negative emotions of humanity
  • Open-world mechanics and fast-paced combat

While Tales of Zestiria has several other great aspects to it, it does have a strong focus on the hunting of mythical creatures known as hellions. Unlike previous entries in the series, this game features open-world mechanics which offer a refreshing perspective and allow players to have more freedom as they search for NPCs to interact with and hellions to take on.

According to the game's lore, hellions are created from impurities resulting from the negative emotions of humanity. Tales of Zestiria explains that hellions are a threat to humanity, which not only justifies the need to haunt them, but also adds another layer of complexity to the story. The game features various party members with different abilities and fast-paced combat that’s always fun and pleasing to look at.

2 SaGa Scarlet Grace: Ambitions

A Complete Monster Hunting Game With Various Attacks, Spells, And Powers

  • Non-linear exploration game mechanics
  • The game features 20 high-ranking Scarlet Fiends

In SaGa: Scarlet Grace - Ambitions , players are tasked with hunting down monsters that threaten the world and those who inhabit it. With non-linear exploration mechanics that offer players the freedom to choose which monsters to take on and where to travel, this game offers hours of fun for those who play it.

While there are other aspects that players can explore throughout the story, monster hunting is key to unlocking certain narrative developments and prized rewards. There are many different regions in this title, each populated with its own creatures. To get the best experience possible, players must balance exploration, combat tactics, and proper resource management and gathering.

SaGa: Scarlet Grace - Ambitions features 20 high-ranking monsters, known as Scarlet Fiends, which represent a considerable challenge and will test players’ resilience and patience.

1 Blue Dragon

An Interesting Concept Of Shadow Creatures And Monster Hunting

  • Interesting concept of shadow creatures
  • The game's open world isn't as complex as in other titles, but it still delivers an enjoyable experience

Blue Dragon will have players control a group of young heroes who have been imbued with the power of shadow creatures. These brave protagonists will have to fight monsters and hunt them down throughout the vast world the game is set in. Unlike other games on this list which are based on real-time combat mechanics, Blue Dragon opts for a turn-based approach instead.

While Blue Dragon does not feature open-world mechanics as complex as other games do, it does have some non-linear action, even when it's often story-restricted. The game offers hours of fun for players as they take on different creatures to reach their ultimate goal. All in all, while the game is a bit lacking on the exploration side of things, it really shines in terms of its combat and its interesting concept of powerful shadow creatures.
